00026 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------
00027    FUNCTION: setup_menu()
00028     PURPOSE: Setup a menu item
00029  DESRIPTION: This way a menu can be defined as an auto variable
00030              within a function. The variables are in the same order
00031              as in the WINDOW type definition
00032     RETURNS: nothing
00033     VERSION: 920117 V0.1 - Initial version
00034 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
00035 void setup_menu(MENU *menu, int i, char *header, int hotkey, void *function,
00036                 char *help, void *data, char *format, int flags)
00037 {
00038   menu[i].header   = header;
00039   menu[i].hotkey   = hotkey;
00040   menu[i].function = function;
00041   menu[i].help     = help;
00042   menu[i].data     = data;
00043   menu[i].format   = format;
00044   menu[i].flags    = flags;
00045 }
00046 
00047 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00048    FUNCTION: init_menu()
00049     PURPOSE: Initialze a menu structure
00050  DESRIPTION: -
00051     RETURNS: nothing
00052     VERSION: 910901 V0.1 - Initial version
00053 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 void init_menu(MENU *menu,  /* Pointer to menu structure to initialize */
00055                int n)       /* Number of menu items to initialize      */
00056 {
00057   int i;
00058 
00059   for (i=0 ; i<n ; i++)
00060   {
00061     menu[i].function = NULL;
00062     menu[i].format = "";
00063     menu[i].hotkey = -1;
00064     menu[i].header = "";
00065     menu[i].help = "";
00066     menu[i].flags = 0;
00067     menu[i].data  = NULL;
00068   }
00069 }

00071 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00072    FUNCTION: set_display_colors()
00073     PURPOSE: Set display colors for COLOR or MONO monitor
00074  DESRIPTION: Sets the global variables according to monitor type
00075              defined. This can be MONO or COLOR.
00076     RETURNS: nothing
00077     VERSION: 911126 V0.1 - Initial version
00078 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 void set_display_colors(int mode)
00080 {
00081   switch(mode)
00082   {
00083     case MONO:
00084       display_mode = MONO;
00085       strcpy(display_mode_str,"MONO");
00086       _menu_att       = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* memu item        */
00087       _menu_hotkey    = (16*BLACK+INTENSE_WHITE) & 0x7F;  /* hotkey of item   */
00088       _menu_highlight = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;          /* highlighted item */
00089       _window_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* window attribute */
00090       _border_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* border           */
00091       _error_att      = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Error window     */
00092       _disabled_att   = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* DISABLED item    */
00093       _comment_att    = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* COMMENT item     */
00094       _dialog_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Dialog menu      */
00095       _desktop_att    = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Desktop attrib   */
00096       break;
00097 
00098     default:
00099       display_mode = COLOR;
00100       strcpy(display_mode_str,"COLOR");
00101       _menu_att       = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* memu item        */
00102       _menu_hotkey    = (16*WHITE+RED)   & 0x7F;      /* hotkey of item   */
00103       _menu_highlight = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;      /* highlighted item */
00104       _window_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;      /* window attribute */
00105       _border_att     = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* border           */
00106       _error_att      = (16*RED+YELLOW)  & 0x7F;      /* Error window     */
00107       _disabled_att   = (16*WHITE+RED)   & 0x7F;      /* DISABLED item    */
00108       _comment_att    = (16*WHITE+BLUE)  & 0x7F;      /* COMMENT item     */
00109       _dialog_att     = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* Dialog menu      */
00110       _desktop_att    = (16*BLUE+YELLOW) & 0x7F;      /* Desktop attr     */
00111       break;
00112   }
00113 }

00115 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00116     FUNCTION: clrscr()
00117      PURPOSE: clear screen
00118  DESCRIPTION: This function is only to be used with MSC.
00119               This is a standard function in TC. We will clear the
00120               entire screen by filling a 'window' with spaces with
00121               BLACK background and WHITE foreground.
00122      RETURNS: Nothing
00123      HISTORY: 910901 V0.1 - Initial version
00124 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00125 #ifdef __MSC__
00126 void clrscr()
00127 {
00128   v_fillarea(0,0,_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines,' ',_desktop_att);
00129 }
00130 #endif

00132 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00133     FUNCTION: printcenter()
00134      PURPOSE: Print a string centered around (row,col).
00135  DESCRIPTION: Calculates center and calls v_prints()
00136      RETURNS: nothing
00137      HISTORY: 910710 V0.1 - Initial version
00138 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 void printcenter(int row,int col, char *string)
00140 {
00141   v_prints(row, col - (strlen(string) >> 1), string);
00142 }
00143 
00144 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00145     FUNCTION: printhotcenter()
00146      PURPOSE: Print a hotstring centered around (row,col)
00147  DESCRIPTION: Calculates center and calls hotstring() with no
00148               hotkey (i.e. -1)
00149      RETURNS: nothing
00150      HISTORY: 911219 V0.1 - Initial version
00151 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00152 void printhotcenter(int row,int col, char *string, int str_att)
00153 {
00154   hotstring(row, col - (strlen(string) >> 1), -1, string, str_att);
00155 }
00156 
00157 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00158     FUNCTION: hotstring()
00159      PURPOSE: print a string with the 'hotkey' set
00160  DESCRIPTION: Print the string on the screen, set the attribute of
00161               the entire string and set the attribute of the 'hotkey'
00162      RETURNS: nothing
00163      HISTORY: 920213 V0.1
00164 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00165 void hotstring(int row, int col, int hotkey, char *string, int str_att)
00166 {
00167   wn_log("hotstring() (%d,%d), hotkey='%d' <%s>\n",row,col,hotkey,string);
00168   v_prints(row,col,string);
00169   v_setattrib_area(row,col,strlen(string),1,str_att);
00170   if (hotkey > -1)
00171     v_setattrib(row,col+hotkey,_menu_hotkey);
00172 }

00174 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00175     FUNCTION: edit()
00176      PURPOSE: Edit data with editstr()
00177  DESCRIPTION: -
00178      RETURNS: nothing
00179      HISTORY: 910829 V0.1 - Initial version
00180 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00181 void edit_data(int row, int col, char *header, char *format, void *data)
00182 {
00183   char s[80];
00184 
00185   void_sprintf(s,format,data);
00186   editstr(row,col,10,header,s,_DRAW);
00187   void_sscanf(s,format,data);
00188 }

00190 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00191     FUNCTION: void_sprintf()
00192      PURPOSE: My own printf() function, including Boolean type
00193  DESCRIPTION: -
00194      RETURNS: Pointer to string, in which is printed
00195      HISTORY: 900624 V0.1 - Initial version
00196 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00197 char *void_sprintf(char *str, char *format, void *data)
00198 {
00199   char *s;
00200   int long_format = FALSE;
00201 
00202   if (!format) /* || !data) */
00203     return(NULL);
00204 
00205   s = strchr(format,'%'); /* Check for format identifier   */
00206   if (!s)                 /* If no identifier, return NULL */
00207     return(NULL);
00208 
00209   s = strpbrk(format,"duouxXfegEGcsB");
00210   if (*(s-1) == 'l')
00211     long_format = TRUE;
00212 
00213   switch (*s)
00214   {
00215     case 'd':
00216     case 'i':
00217       if (long_format)
00218         sprintf(str,format, *((long *) data));
00219       else
00220         sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
00221       break;
00222     case 'o':
00223     case 'u':
00224     case 'x':
00225       sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
00226       break;
00227     case 'X':
00228       if (long_format)
00229         sprintf(str,format,*((unsigned long *) data));
00230       else
00231         sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
00232       break;
00233     case 'f':
00234     case 'e':
00235     case 'g':
00236     case 'E':
00237     case 'G':
00238       if (long_format)
00239         sprintf(str,format,*((double *)data));
00240       else
00241         sprintf(str,format, *((float *) data));
00242       break;
00243     case 'c':
00244       sprintf(str,format,*(char *)data);
00245       break;
00246     case 's':
00247       sprintf(str,format,(char *) data);
00248       break;
00249     case 'B':
00250       if ((int *)data)
00251         strcpy(str,"ON");
00252       else
00253         strcpy(str,"OFF");
00254       break;
00255     default:
00256       break;
00257   }
00258 
00259   return(str);
00260 }
00261 
00262 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00263     FUNCTION: void_sscanf()
00264      PURPOSE: Scan data from a string, typecasting the void pointer
00265  DESCRIPTION: -
00266      RETURNS: nothing
00267      HISTORY: 900624 V0.1 - Initial version
00268 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00269 void void_sscanf(char *str, char *format, void *data)
00270 {
00271   char *s;
00272   char *dummy;
00273   int long_format = FALSE;
00274 
00275   s = strchr(format,'%'); /* Check for format identifier   */
00276   if (!s)                 /* If no identifier, return NULL */
00277     return;
00278 
00279   if (format == NULL)
00280     return;
00281 
00282   s = strpbrk(format,"duouxXfegEGcsB");
00283   if (*(s-1) == 'l')
00284     long_format = TRUE;
00285 
00286   switch (*s)
00287   {
00288     case 'd':
00289     case 'i':
00290       if (long_format)
00291         *(long *)data = atol(str);
00292       else
00293         *(int *)data = atoi(str);
00294       break;
00295 
00296     case 'o':
00297       *(unsigned int *)data = (unsigned int) strtol(str,&dummy,8);
00298       break;
00299 
00300     case 'O':
00301       *(long *)data = strtoul(str,&dummy,8);
00302       break;
00303 
00304     case 'u':
00305       *(unsigned int *)data = (unsigned int) strtoul(str,&dummy,10);
00306       break;
00307 
00308     case 'U':
00309       *(long *)data = strtoul(str,&dummy,10);
00310       break;
00311 
00312     case 'x':
00313       *(unsigned int *) data = (unsigned int) strtoul(str,&dummy,16);
00314       break;
00315 
00316     case 'X':
00317       *(long *) data = strtoul(str,&dummy,16);
00318       break;
00319 
00320     case 'f':
00321     case 'e':
00322     case 'g':
00323     case 'E':
00324     case 'G':
00325       if (long_format)
00326         *(double *)data = atof(str);
00327       else
00328         *(float *)data = (float) atof(str);
00329       break;
00330 
00331     case 'c':
00332       sscanf(str,"%c",(char *)data);
00333       break;
00334 
00335     case 's':
00336       strcpy((char *)data,str);
00337       break;
00338 
00339     default:
00340       break;
00341   }
00342 }

00344 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00345     FUNCTION: disp_status()
00346      PURPOSE: display a message on line 23
00347  DESCRIPTION: -
00348      RETURNS: nothing
00349      HISTORY: 911106 V0.1 - Initial version
00350 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00351 void disp_status(char *format, ...)
00352 {
00353   va_list arguments;
00354   static unsigned int i = 0;
00355   int len;
00356   char s[132];
00357 
00358   /*------------------------------------
00359     Generate the string
00360   -------------------------------------*/
00361   va_start(arguments,format);
00362   vsprintf(s,format,arguments);
00363   va_end(arguments);
00364 
00365   /*------------------
00366     Trim the string
00367   ------------------*/
00368   len = strlen(s);
00369   for (i=len ; i<_cursvar.cols ; i++)
00370     s[i] = ' ';
00371   s[_cursvar.cols] = '\0';
00372 
00373   /*-----------------------------------
00374     Print string on bottom of display
00375   ------------------------------------*/
00376   v_prints(_cursvar.lines,1,s);
00377 
00378 }
00379 
00380 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00381     FUNCTION: show_time()
00382      PURPOSE: Display time in upper right corner of display
00383  DESCRIPTION: -
00384      RETURNS: nothing
00385      HISTORY: 920212 V0.1
00386 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00387 void show_time()
00388 {
00389   char timestr[9];
00390   time_t     tnow;
00391   struct tm  *tmnow;
00392 
00393   /*--------------------------
00394   | Get and print actual time
00395   ---------------------------*/
00396   time(&tnow);
00397   tmnow = localtime(&tnow);
00398   sprintf(timestr,"%02d:%02d:%02d",tmnow->tm_hour,tmnow->tm_min,tmnow->tm_sec);
00399   v_prints(0,_cursvar.cols-7,timestr);
00400 }
